reviews.review_text: Simply THE BEST Oyster House in town. Awesome  happy hour  deal, the atmosphere is always amazing, AND great food qualities! My wife and I enjoyed every visit, I am pretty sure you will and can find your  oyster  here! Oh, yeah, don t forget their soup, mussel & clams, and drinks! And and their spicy sauce selection! Spicy Caesar, my favorite~

By far one of my favourite place to go in Vancouver! Every time we go to Vancouver we make sure we stop by the Rodney oyster s house in Yaletown. From fresh oysters to one of the best service I ve had in a restaurant, this is definitely a place you need to try. Every single plate was perfect and came super fast, we got the crab cakes, garlic shrimps, shrimp cocktail, clams, mussels and obviously oysters. Everything was so fresh and the oysters come with a lot of different choices of sauces for you to choose from. Very clean restaurant and very cute ambiance for a date, a dinner with friends or even to just go by yourself ! The staff working there has one of the best service I ve seen in years, they are really on point and so friendly and nice, this is one of the reasons we always go back there, we just love the ambiance and service so much, a lot of place should take exemple of this place ! We ve been served by Mackenzie and sadly I don t forget the name of the other employees that took care of us but it isn t the last time they will see us in the establishment! IF YOU LOVE SEAFOOD AND GOOD VIBES YOU NEED TO TRY THIS PLACE !

Great establishment.    If you plan to visit, try to make reservations.  Its not a large restaurant, and spaces fill up quickly.  I would definitely recommend the raw oysters, calamari, and fish dip.  Our group enjoyed EVERYTHING that came to our table.

I tried oysters for the first time at Rodneys and Ive been hooked ever since! Cant go wrong with seafood anywhere on the the west coast but Rodneys is extra special. I was at the location during a work trip and the staff made sure we were served on time so we can get back to work on time. The chef also came and said hello - super nice. Loved the decor as well!

Highly recommend making a reservation for some delish eats at Rodney s. We went last Saturday, sat at the bar where Mehdi delivered both great service and entertainment as he worked the soups and steamers. The atmosphere is FUN. Go hungry. It s not cheap - but you get VALUE for the food.

Im very impressed with the quality of Rodneys Oyster House. Great food and service, a fun place to be in, top class all around. We found that it is important to reserve a table, even in the middle of the week (it was summer, too, so that might add a bit). The waiter was great, the hot sauce defection was wonderful, and the choices in oyster types was unexpected and fantastic to have. We dove right in, so if you see the picture I took you can tell that a lot of the oysters had already been eaten by the time I got my camera out. You know, you go away from raw oysters for a while and you start thinking, Im kind of ok without them, or Did I really eat those things? But then you get taken to Rodneys and you relearn that oysters are amazing things to eat.

Its one of the original fun oyster bars in Vancouver.  A variety of oyster and fresh seafood choices to pick from.  A favorite is the steamed chowder made in front of you and poured into a bowl for you to enjoy.  Fun lively staff keep the energy high and enjoyable banter Parking: Yaletown is often a challenge to find parking due to the popularity of the area and limited street parking.

An amazing seafood restaurant! Great food, service and atmosphere! Highly recommend this hidden gem if you are wanting an excellent seafood experience :) Kid-friendliness: Saw some families with kids and they seem to have a good time :)
Loved the food and experience, one of the servers taught me to eat raw oyesters since I had never tried them before. Was way more expensive than I was expecting, went for a lunch by myself.
If you are a oyster lover, I suggest getting the BC oyster selection. It was amazing and tasted so good. Would definitely come again!

I liked the lively atmosphere of the restaurant. I got lobster poutine and salmon salad. Both tasted great! I sat at the bar, and the bartender was kind to the customers. I recommend this place for a good, filling dinner.

Absolutely amazing service and the guys behind the bar are so fun and helpful. Medhi, our server was fun and extremely knowledgeable on suggestions on the menu. We ended up eating a dozen oysters, also had  the muscles which are absolutely out of this world and the shrimp and lobster roll was very good as well. I cant recommend this place enough, the place is  fun,  fabulous and some of the best food in town.

I had 12 assorted oysters and my wife had mini lobsters & shrimp sliders, both delicious! Service is very good; reservation advised. Parking: Usually full, have to park far away. I recommend Canada Line. Kid-friendliness: Not at all for kids; it is a Bar.

The hospitality here is unmatched, it s unlike anywhere I ve ever been in the best way possible. I spent 6 hours from opening to closing sitting at the bar getting to know the staff (they were all too lovely to leave), and had the time of my life! Great food, great music, and even better conversation with every staff member that took time out of their night to get to know me. All around a wonderful place to be! :)

Great vibes and service in this joint. Casual and fancy at the same time (wine is served in rock glasses haha). The oyster platter recommended was really yummy - appreciated our server giving tips on how to have them (only with horseradish and a smidge of vinaigrette!) Mussels were great, especially with the bread to soak up the sauce. Lobster is divine with a great sauce that went well with all the accompanying sides, and clarified butter - only acceptable dipping sauce for lobster. No mayo or anything that outshines this tasty crustacean!

10/10 for service and food. Our server was Micheal and his attitude was great when he was efficient and going around vibing with the music. But just not the service was great. The food was on par too. We had -Lobster Poutine which I definitely recommend everyone try as it s super rich in flavour and the serving size was more then enough for 2 people. -12 oysters(6 from the west coast, 6 from PEI)these were definitely fresh and two different flavours. The one being from the west coast looking more of a deep shell and darker meat. Being sweet and more flavourful. Compared to the ones from PEI being a more shallow shell and lighter meat. Concluding to a more salty flavour. Ended up grabbing 2 more of the west coast because being so fresh and delicious. -New England Clam Chowder was another good choice if you want a classic clam chowder. Will come back again in the future or recommend anyone that comes to Vancouver for a visit

A great seafood restaurant with a cozy environment, fresh crab and lobster and oysters and delicious muscles. All the food on their menu tastes great. But my favorite is the Lobster rolls and the Halibut. The lobster rolls are not kn the menu so you should ask the waiters for it. The staff are super friendly and very professional. They brought the food in an order that we had food all the time and they didnt bring all the food at the same time. The environment is also clean and cozy and the kitchen is clean.

Great place to go for seafood! Really enjoyed eating the full crab, calamari, oysters, mussels and who can forget the famous clam chowder soup with crackers.   Hubby and I enjoyed our date night here! Will be back again soon

The food and service was amazing. I really loved the way of presenting this restaurant. Food was fresh and delicious. Service very prompt and friendly. The ambiance very unique. I went in for a happy hour evening was perfect. Thank you We will be back.

A must go vancouver oyster house ! Very fresh oysters and great ambiance. 2 locations to choose one in gas town and the other in yaletown but always preferred the original yaletown location. Must order : oysters, New England clam chowder, shrimp cocktail and Bloody Mary! Manhattan clam chowder not as good but can try. Crab cake not bad and portion not so big. Very friendly service overall!

I had a great time at Rodneys. The service was amazing. Super friendly and helpful crew.   The food was absolutely delicious. All the ingredients are so fresh. I will definitely come back for more.   Highly recommended!

We got to sit at the back of the restaurant and it was nice and quiet. The happy hour oysters paired well with all the different sauces available. Id recommend coming before the peak hours to avoid the noise and the crowd. If you happen to order the dip, do not be afraid to ask for more bread if you run out too!

If you come to Vancouver and do not visit this place, then you are missing some truly great seafood. From the garlic prawns to the strawberry shortcake, every single dish was a treat. The fresh oysters were fresh indeed. The meal could not have been better. A must visit and recommend when visiting vancity!

Another nice visit to Rodney s Ouster House and it did not disappoint. We ordered 2 dozen shucked oysters New England chowder Manhattan chowder Clams Seafood pasta 2lb steamed lobster And key lime pie to top it off Amazing food and service. Originally booked for 7 but arrived late, they were able to accommodate us within 10 minutes with great seats.  Staff are super friendly and quick to help. Food is delicious and not over seasoned. Highly recommended

This place has the best seafood. We had the west coast oysters and they were fantastic. Then seafood pasta and the halibut. Both excellent. The food was a bit slow in coming; the waiter said they only had one person shucking that night, but he topped up our wine and all was forgiven. Definitely recommend.

This place draws you in from the outside the smell of butter and seafood. We came for happy hour one day and the food was incredible. Service was friendly and we had the fried oysters, mussels, garlic prawns, and raw oysters along with a couple beers and drinks. The mussels came with quite a bit of sauce that was quickly lapped up with all of the bread. Would definitely stop back as I m eager to try out some of the entrees.

These are the best oysters Ive ever had! We ordered 18 and they were so clean, not a single grain of sand present. Beer was ice cold, clam chowder was delicious, and lobster poutine was incredible. Great service too. I highly recommend!

Wow the server was so entertaining, he made our experience so unforgettable. Very generous pour with the chardonnay it almost spilled over. I loved the large selection of seafood and of course the oysters. Was impressed by the portion sizes and the presentation was decent. Prices were reasonable. It was a little loud in the restaurant and it didn t have much capacity even with a second floor / loft. Parking is always challenging in Yaletown so if you want to head out here, take transit. It s very close to the station.

Huge tasty oysters! Pricey dishes but very delicious. Blown away with each dish. The clam chowder was probably the best clam chowder I ve ever had, the bread it was fresh and delicious. The scallop linguine was phenomenal, and the crabcake dish balanced so well with the salad it came with. An 11 out of 10 experience, really high end ingredients prepared perfectly. Absolutely would recommend, and even worth the high price.

Crab was excellent (the melted butter tasted funny for the crab), the asparagus & potatoes were amazing (perfect amount of spicy). Oysters were amazing, I LOVED 1 of the sauces (the dark purple vinaigrette one). The butter that was for the bread was the best butter Ive tasted (homemade old fashioned vibes, favorite kind) loved it. Service of getting my 1st (and only) drink took a very long time (asked for easy spice .. and it came spicy af w/alot of horseradish) .. I couldnt finish my drink, I think I drank a few inches. Oh well ... they were busy.

This was my first time at Rodneys. I visited this place on a Sat night and it was a great experience. To start with the services were fantastic and staff was super friendly. I was recommended a few dishes as a first timer at this place. I tried Oysters, Garlic Prawns and Atlantic Lobster Poutine. Starting with Oysters, as they were just amazing. Then we got Garlic Prawns, which were served with a bit of garlic soup and bread on the side. This was my first ever time trying the dish and I just couldnt stop myself once I tasted it. It was fabulous. Lastly the lobster poutine which was equally delicious and filling. I will definitely recommend Rodneys to all my friends and family. Cheers!! Parking: Usually available in front of the restaurant. Wheelchair accessibility: There are 2 floors but only floor 1 is accessible to wheelchair

Fabulous service and a great way to spend a Monday night. Recommendations from the staff were great - the  Oyster Guy  was a wealth of information. And   the carrot cake for dessert was perfect. Will go back again soon!

This is a great oyster bar in Yaletown. Their seafood is always fresh and the service is friendly. It can get very busy here so you way want to call ahead. They have really good clam chowder (both New England and Manhattan style). Their Caesar is a great cocktail to order. It is worth a visit if you are close by.

We had an amazing experience today at Rodney s!! A huge shout out to Mackenzie who took excellent care of us. Best server ever!! Great conversationalist, explained the ins and outs of oysters, rang the bell for the  oyster virgins  and was just a super genuine guy! Make sure you sit at the bar!!!

Awesome spot! Great food, I had lobster poutine and it was delicious. Apples were good too. Our waitress Andrea made the visit a lot of fun, as well as the other server and kitchen staff! Dudes! Who ordered the chow chow! Delicious.

Stopped by for  low tide  and had a fabulous meal. Everything was delicious and fairly priced. The beverages were perfect and the service was on point. Highly recommended, especially if you re a seafood fan!
Such a great restaurant for oysters and other seafood. Its cozy and I like the atmosphere very much. Friendly stuff and good quality food. I really liked it here and we had a great time.

It was suggested that I try Rodney s for oysters and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere was fun and unpretentious, oysters were great, service was great and the staff was exceptional! All around great fun time!

Take advantage of their low tide menu (happy hour). I do believe it starts from 3 pm to 6 pm if I am not mistakened.  Dont forget to ask for extra bread, youll be needing those for your steamed shellfish.  I give them 5 stars- 4 for food and ambiance + 1 star for their GQ servers  .

Pretty Awesome Spot for Lobster and Oysters.  Had a Few Items which were  Really Good.  I just wasnt a Fan of the Poutine, Lobster was good but very Heavy Tasting Fries and Gravy.  Maybe another day I should give it a Try.  Oysters Were Awesome Had 10!  Lobster Rolls were Fresh and Delicious.  Would Come Back Again.
Fantastic genuine service. Great food too of course - we had the steamed clams, halibut hits, and crab dip during their happy hour.

I loved this place! Even though it is super pricy. We paid around $130 for 12 oysters each and for 4 beers. The atmosphere and the design makes you feel that you are just next to the ocean at a local bar or pub. The service is very friendly and the staff is rather easy-going than too serious.

Whoa, I had an amazing time here on a Friday post-work outing. Servers were so fun and social with the customers, and the food was awesome. Oysters and Mussels were good, but my favourite was the ****Garlic Shrimp****. Highly recommend checking this place out. First-timers, brace yourselves for delight.

The best spot in Yaletown for a laid-back beverage at the bar chased by oysters. The bar staff are the friendliest around and always make you feel welcome, whether its your first or tenth time there. Highly recommend the lobster and shrimp sliders. The horseradish is the freshest around and enhances these fresh oysters.
Great place. Good food.  Excellent music. Drinking with Dhillon. Food
Amazing food! One of my favourite restaurants in town! The staff here are very friendly and very efficient. Definitely worth a try!!

My friends and I have been here a few times now, and always have so much fun! The crew / staff are super friendly and charismatic. The oysters & lobster shrimp sliders are yummy. So many great seafood options to try

Great place for some great seafood! Quite busy, so book a table. Staff is awesome and like I said before the food is awesome! The dessert options, cheesecake and chocolate mouse were both to die for. Definitely would come back.
Took my lady for a belated birthday dinner and had a great experience from entry to exit and all in between. Definitely a must stop in Yaletown
Super fun experience and super fresh oysters. I have never had this many in one go but definitely a place for a fun time with friends. The staff are the best and so friendly as well!
Fun & Delicious : the place to be in Vancouver!!! Enjoy over two floors seafood specialities, oysters and handmade pasta Service is friendly
Some of the best oysters I have ever had. Freshly shucked when you order. They have a lot of sauces but really would have like to try basic cocktail Sauce.
I love Rodney s, and if you love oysters, you will love Rodney s too. It s that simple. Though, at about $4 each, its not a cheap feed...

This was my first visit to Rodneys   . What can I say....from the moment we entered it was high energy, exceptional customer service  and positive vibes all around. The gents serving our table were all super friendly and had the best sense of humor. A member of the upper management team even came over and chatted with us to ensure we were well taken care of. Without a doubt- this place SHOULD be on everyones go to list. You cant help but leave feeling amazing .....just from the positive energy floating around. Cant wait to go back.

This is an excellent place for couples, or parties it brings an upbeat vibe with an old school feeling, Michael was absolutely fabulous! Very friendly, charismatic, and knowledgeable, and was an absolute delight ! Will definitely be returning!
Great oyster selection, loved the candied salmon salad, and the service was excellent.  It s cozy but modern inside with good music and an overall great vibe.
The restaurant is clean and organized. Oysters are fresh and perfectly chewy with a variety of choices of sauce. Overall a 5 star place for seafood. Would definitely come back again!
Nice, fresh food, especially the Oysters!! If tou can eat more, Id like to recommend banana cremble. And also great staffs are in there. Dont be hesitate to go there.
So friendly and nice Delicious food Food
Absolutely live this place. The quality of the the Nd staff is excellent.  Highly recommended.  Good wine choice too.
We had oysters and shared the pasta. Both delicious. I liked the different sauces for oysters.

Very friendly service. Tried their grilled halibut at the staffs recommendation - it was grilled to perfection and beautifully presented too. Also tried 3 kinds of oysters. The server explained the dishes very patiently. The restaurant is in a loft building. The lower level seats more people and the upper one was less noisy the night I was there. Its a bar and restaurant, Noisy is normal. Booking in advance is recommended, they do get very busy. Overall  it was a very happy dining experience and I would like to come back there in the future.
Decided to try this place out for my birthday, we had an amazing time. The staff was wonderful, the seafood fresh, the drinks tasty. No complains, everything was perfect. Thanks for making my day!
My friends always come here for happy hour oysters. Im not raw oyster person but i love everything cooked here. Crazy line up but cozy place, friendly staff too.

Delicious oysters, friendly staffs, and toddler friendly - they made a lot of food adjustments for our two-year-old - and generally everything was delicious. Was quite impressed with their classic Caesar - I d come back again for their oyster + Caesar.
Amazing place for seafood.  Really great variety of oysters.  Lobster poutine is good too
Great atmosphere in a trendy pert of town! Knowledgeable staff. Everything we had tasted great. If you like ceasers then you need to try theirs.
Always, consistently, phenomenal service and food! I wish I lived closer!
We all had different dishes and everything was excellent. The servers were fast and friendly and the place has a great atmosphere.
This place is unreal. Beats every oyster place in Miami that I ve ever been to (where I live). Oysters are perfect. Clam chowder the best I ve ever had.  Great service and vibe too.

I loved the vibe. The service was great. The waiters were all so cool. Loved the food. Best seafood Ive tried in Vancouver Vegetarian options: You can choose to have the Pasta without any meat, fish but this restaurant is a seafood restaurant. You should try their seafood dishes if you go.
Fresh and tasty oysters, mussels and clams. We also got there during happy hour, great timing.
The food was great, service was great (thanks Jeff!). If you want to eat reasonably priced seafood, this place is a must :)

Summer isnt the same without Rodneys low tide happy hour. Theres a reason why I keep coming back so Ill keep this review short as anyone you ask where to go for oysters will tell you to come to here. Not to mention their lobster mac n cheese and their lousiana hot crab dip are bomb. They have 2 locations, Gastown and Yaletown. Keep in mind there are no reservations so come early. All the staff are friendly and outgoing. Great place to grab a bite, take a date or catch up with friends. Hands down, best oysters locally! If you find a place better, please let me know because I havent found one so far..

Oysters are fresh, mussels are great, clam chowder is tasty, bread is also good.   Ok the lobster roll I couldnt really taste much lobster meat and for 30$ the 3 little buns felt overpriced,  the brioche bun is maybe abit too oily, thats one dish I might not order again. Service is good. Food

Loved the easy going atmosphere here.  Great staff, great food. Loved the fresh oysters, and clam chowder.  The guys work hard here, and hustle like they are owners. Seems like a great place to work, and it shows. This really was the highlight of my 22 hour layover in Vancouver!  Awesome experience.
Pretty ambient environment. Food is good and service is excellent. Would recommend to anyone who wants to try out their famous lobster poutine.
Seafood stew and lobster poutine were excellent. Our server was fantastic. We also had oyster and they were super delicious. Highly recommended.

this place is great. had an awesome dinner with friends tonight, with equally awesome service. staff are super attentive and have great personalities. we asked the staff their opinions on Chewbaccas member and were not disappointed. 10/10 would talk about genitalia again
Great price! Top notch quality paired with a fun atmosphere. You can tell they take pride in what they serve.
Bring back the 1.50$ oysters !!
One of the staff name is AJ, He was really kind and professional. He explained us whatever we asked. Being kind is a second nature to him. Food was great as well. :)
Tastes like its fresh out of the ocean. Excellent service... make sure to save your pennies because this place isnt cheap. Well with it though.
Legendary! Vancouvers finest oyster bar!
Always fun - great selection of oysters. First time I tried spot prawns and the broth they came with was simply delicious. Great Service as well.

Definitely one of the best oyster house. Always with the fresh ones. Knowledgeable servers that can recommend from different choices. Lots of other seafood options if you are not into osyters. Definitely take advantage of their happy hour if you can. Lots of drink options too. Perfect place for a date or a couple of friends hanging out.
Great vibe on a Saturday happy hour.  Service was excellent and friendly and the oysters were awesome.
The steamed mussels were so buttery and smooth. The waiters were really friendly and helpful to make recommendations to out of town guests.
the most immaculate vibes in vancouver, if not the planet. love this place and cant wait to go back. get the crab dip, you wont regret it

This has been one of my favouite spots to dine in since about 1996! The atmosphere here is magic and thats due to an amazing staff and great food.  Best chowder in the city. Currently serving, the New England and Manhattan versions. Two of my favourites are on covid-19 holiday, the Corn Chowder and my personal favourite The Slap Jack (leek and fresh poached oysters)! I look forward to their return. Happy Hour is called Low Tide and is the best spot in town for happy hour food and drinks. Wine is poured into a 5.5 oz glass filled to the top so be prepared to sip, in place, from the table. Lastly, a shout out, the music play list is awesome! You cant go wrong at Rodneys Oyster House in Yaletown. There is a location in Gastown that is awesome but the atmosphere in Yaletown is magical!
Great service! Staff are chill and welcoming. Food was awesome! Had a great time
Great selection of food and everything was delicious!  Lobster poutine, mini lobster rolls, and raw oysters.  Awesome!
Nice vibe. Tasty food. Quick service. Enjoyed our family dinner there.

We are here two days in a row. All of the oysters were fresh and chilled to perfection. The lobster and crab rolls are delicious. We finished with the fried oysters which served as dessert. Bonus are all the sauces they have to dress your oysters.

Great vibes, good food, large portions, excellent service. Only small gripe was that food took a bit longer to leave the kitchen but the overall atmosphere made up for it. Our order: - Oyster sampler (dozen per order, so good we had two orders) - Lobster Poutine - House Salad (dressing low key tasted like Big Mac sauce) - New England Clam Chowder

I went with my friend to this restaurant pretty spontaneously for lunch and all I can say is the moment I stepped inside I knew it was going to be a good time. The interior is so cosy and the festive ambiance is very cute. The service was very polite, efficient and courteous. The food   was delicious. I really enjoyed the meals we got and I totally recommend the Oyster Po boy and obviously the oysters. Great selections of sauce to accompany the oysters ~ Overall lovely time, great food and service. Now you just need to enjoy it yourself by going as well :-) Cheers~
Very casual place. The food is exceptional! Oysters from west and east coast, so good! Lively crowd, good music.

Amazing, delicious and wonderful service! Came here as a party of three, ordered two dozen oysters as a part of happy hour. Also ordered three entrees to share amongst the three of us. Each entree was well received. Will definitely come back again in the near future!

A really fun place in Yaletown.  We got there at Low Tide (Happy Hour) and had the fresh oysters on the half-shell which were delicious with the wide array of sauces provided. The clam chowder and the hot crab dip were also excellent.
Delicious Fresh tasty oysters! Prices are decent, various beverage option and great sides. Be sure to get low tide prices to get the best deal! Friendly customer service.
